verses.verse: "Amen, amen, I tell you, the person not going in through the door into the yard of the sheep, but climbing up some other way, that person is a thief and a bandit.
The one going in through the door is a shepherd of the sheep.
To this one, the doorkeeper opens up, and the sheep listen to his voice. And he hollers for his own sheep by name and leads them out.
And whenever he takes his own sheep out, he travels in front of them, and the sheep follow him because they know his voice.
A shepherd belonging to others they won't in any way follow, but they will escape away from him because they don't know the voice of the shepherds belonging to others."
Jesus told this analogy to them, but those people didn't know what things it was that He was speaking to them.
So Jesus said to them again, "Amen, amen, I tell you, I am the door of the sheep.
Everyone, as many as came before Me are thieves and bandits, but the sheep didn't listen to them.
I am the door. Through Me, if anyone goes in, he will be rescued. And he will go in and go out, and will find pasture.
The thief doesn't come except so that he might steal, kill, and ruin. I came so that they may have life and have much more.
I am the Shepherd, the Nice One. The Shepherd, the Nice One, puts His soul out there on behalf of the sheep.
The hired worker (not also being a shepherd, whose sheep are not his own) sees the wolf coming, leaves the sheep, and escapes. And the wolf snatches them and scatters the sheep.
The hired worker escapes because he is a hired worker and there is no concern in him about the sheep.
I am the Shepherd, the Nice One, I know My sheep, and I am known by My sheep,
just as the Father knows Me and I know the Father. And I put my soul out there on behalf of the sheep.
And I have other sheep that are not from this yard. And it is necessary for Me to lead those sheep. And they will listen to My voice, and it will become one flock, one Shepherd.
Because of this, the Father loves Me, because I put my soul out there so that I might receive it again.

No one takes it away from Me, but I put it out there out from Myself. I have authority to put it out there, and I have authority to receive it again. I received this demand from the side of My Father."
So there became a split again among the Jewish people because of these messages.
Many from among them were saying, "He has a demon and is crazy. Why are you listening to Him?"
Others were saying, "These are not the statements of a person who has a demon. A demon is not able to be opening eyes of blind people, is it?"
It became Hanukkah (the initiations) in Greater Jerusalem, and there was a storm.
And Jesus was traipsing around on the temple grounds in the Columned Shelter of Solomon.
So the Jewish people surrounded Him and were saying to Him, "Until when are You raising our souls? If You are the Anointed King, tell us openly."
Jesus answered them, "I told you, and you do not trust. The actions that I do in the name of My Father, these things are witnesses concerning Me.
But you do not trust. You see, you are not from the sheep, My sheep, just as I told you.
The sheep, My sheep, listen to My voice, I know them, and they follow Me.
And I give them life that spans all time, they will not in any way be ruined for the span of time, and someone will not snatch them from My hand.
My Father, who has given them to Me, is greater than everyone, and no one is able to be snatching them from the hand of My Father.
I and the Father are one."
So again the Jewish people hauled stones so that they might attack Him with stones.
Jesus responded to them, "I showed you many nice actions from My Father. Because of which action of these are you attacking Me with stones?"
The Jewish people answered Him, saying, "We are not attacking You with stones concerning a nice action, but concerning a hurtful comment and because You, being a person, make Yourself a god."
Jesus responded to them, "Is it not a thing that has been written in your law, (in Psalm 82:6) 'I said, You are gods'?
If He called those people gods to whom the message of God happened, and the Old Testament writing is not able to be undone,
are you saying concerning whom the Father made sacred and sent out into the world, 'You are saying hurtful things,' because I said, 'I am a son of God'?
If I am not doing the actions of My Father, don't trust Me.
But if I am doing them, even if you don't trust Me, trust the actions so that you might know and trust that the Father is in Me and I in Him."
So they were looking again to arrest Him, and He went out of their hand.
And He went off again to the other side of the Jordan River to the place where John was submerging the first time, and He stayed there.
And many went to Him and were saying, "John certainly didn't do even one indicator, but everything as much as John said about this Man was truthful."
And many trusted in Him there.
